p: Using peripheral blood mononuclear cells, Santos et al. (2016) investigated the impact of a dichloromethane-ethanol extract of E. campestre (6.25, 12.5 and 25 μg/ml) on pathological processes of chronic inflammatory diseases. In a concentration-dependent manner, the extract inhibited the proliferation of T lymphocytes, including CD4 + and CD8 + cells, and decreased IL-2 levels in the supernatant of the cell cultures, a cytokine essential for the expansion of T lymphocytes.
